1.Pros: It was a very simple job. I'd recommend it to someone who doesn't have any experience with working.
1.Cons: Not all that great of pay, and the work is long. There isn't much of free time either.

2.Pros: You have benefits, you can go higher up, you can increase your development.
2.Cons: You might have short of help some days, You might not have enough people working that day

3.Pros: Its fun, most of the customers are happy, & the foods okay.
3.Cons: The bosses were mean, & they fired me illegally.

4.Pros: There actually was room for advancement. Performed well and received prompt promotions.
4.Cons: The turnover is so high so building any sort of relationship through work is nearly impossible.

5.Pros: Everything was great. Good staff. They are around 16-20s. Some are older. Great working. Management is decent. Learn a lot as a fort job.
5.Cons: Customers at times. Cleaning the bathrooms. Dealing with people you do not get along with very well. Managers can be a bit rough.

6.Pros: Flexibility, resume builder, great management program, great training, decent money for the younger crowd, great experience
6.Cons: Deal with angry customers, working with food, only for certain people

7.Pros: It's a good job for college students who are just working to get their career set. But, it's definitely not a career.
7.Cons: Very stressful, and low pay. Doesn't require much and did I mention the low pay? It's very hard to survive

8.Pros: It was nice to do and nice to get customer service experience if youre a cashier. I was very close with everyone I worked with so I got to work both cook and Cashier at times. Tends to work with school hours. Raises are acceptable, and promotions available.
8.Cons: Pay is not that great if youre not a high school student or summer worker, promotions seem desperate so training is lacking in some places. Smell like burgers after work. Slow feeling shifts even during busy periods.

9.Pros: Meet new people and its always freenfood offered when you have to wait longer than expected
9.Cons: Managers are disrespectful and they hold on when its time for you to go home
